metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6194 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The relocs function in libr/bin/p/bin_bflt.c in radare2 1.2.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted binary file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6194` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libradare2-2.3 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
libradare2-common - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
radare2 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: radare2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.0+dfsg-2').
